definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: The view is of the nondescript building across the street.
sentences.chinese: 風景就是對面街那不可名狀的建築物。

sentences.english: Nothing can describe the peace that surrounded the country parsonage.
sentences.chinese: 鄉村的牧師住宅，四周靜謐得難以名狀。

sentences.english: Until now I have talked about the relation of dreams with the inexpressible .
sentences.chinese: 我目前已談到夢與莫可名狀的體驗的關係。

sentences.english: It is a kind of indescribable feeling of numerous cross.
sentences.chinese: 那是一種無可名狀的紛繁交叉的心情。

sentences.english: Then you have the intangible elements, which can also be quite personal.
sentences.chinese: 但是你也有一些十分私人的，無可名狀的情緒。

sentences.english: He was troubled by nameless fears.
sentences.chinese: 難以名狀的恐懼困擾着他。

sentences.english: That which cannot be given name and form, for it is without quality and beyond consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 餘下者不可名狀，因它沒有屬性且超越意識。

sentences.english: Stanley felt a nameless anxiety rising in him .
sentences.chinese: 史坦利覺得心頭湧起一股不可名狀的憂慮。

sentences.english: This is the soda green charm, indescribable, but real.
sentences.chinese: 這就是蘇打綠的魅力，無可名狀，但實實在在。

sentences.english: Concept or faith? It's difficult to name.
There is some indefinable want in their make-up.
sentences.chinese: 他們的本性中有某種無法名狀的需要。

sentences.english: I was seized by a nameless horror.
sentences.chinese: 我爲不可名狀的恐慌所控制。

sentences.english: They walked northward with a curious feeling of disappointment.
sentences.chinese: 他們向北行，心頭彷彿襲來一縷不可名狀的落寞之感。

sentences.english: She had an indescribably magnetic attraction to her father's world.
sentences.chinese: 父親的那個世界對她產生了一種難以名狀的磁力。

sentences.english: Everytime I look deep into your eyes, I suffer a feeling of unspeakable melancholy.
sentences.chinese: 每次凝視你的眼眸，一種難以名狀的憂鬱便攫住了我。
